parsetree.*:
<root><template><title>RV</title><part><name>type</name>=<value>command

</value></part><part><name index="1"/><value> ofp

</value></part><part><name index="2"/><value>1.00

</value></part><part><name>eff</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>arg</name>=<value> global

</value></part><part><name>gr1</name>=<value> Object Manipulation

</value></part><part><name index="3"/><value> Damage / repair object.

Damage 0 means fully functional, damage 1 means completely destroyed / dead.<br>

Alias of [[setDamage]], which was introduced to fix a spelling error in this operator's name.

</value></part><part><name index="4"/><value> object [[setDammage]] damage

</value></part><part><name>p1</name>=<value> object: [[Object]]

</value></part><part><name>p2</name>=<value> damage: [[Number]]

</value></part><part><name index="5"/><value> [[Nothing]]
		  
</value></part><part><name>x1</name>=<value> <code>_soldier1 [[setDammage]] 1;</code>

</value></part><part><name>seealso</name>=<value> [[setDamage]], [[setVehicleArmor]], [[damage]], [[getDammage]], [[setHit]], [[getHit]], [[getHitIndex]], [[setHitIndex]], [[getHitPointDamage]], [[setHitPointDamage]]
</value></part></template>

<dl class="command_description">
<comment><!-- Note Section BEGIN -->
</comment>
<dd class="notedate">Posted on April 17, 2006‎ - 07:39 (CEST)</dd>
<dt class="note">[[User:Fragorl|Fragorl]]</dt>
<dd class="note">In '''OFP''', setting a unit's damage to a negative value will set it is health to full, but impair their aim.

<comment><!-- Note Section END -->
</comment></dl>
